Posts.Content: Nov 15, 2007 05:01PM Kimarene wrote: Hi Hannah - I had a lumpectomy on Sept 12th; however, I have pretty large breasts - so large, in fact, that I can't tell any tissue is missing!  I'm sorry to hear you're having issues, but most likely it will look better as time goes on.
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy Site Appearance Hannah916 kcpc

Posts.Content: Nov 17, 2007 10:28PM Kimarene wrote: Hi - Hang in there.  It is very difficult to wait, I know.  I have heard that cancer lumps don't hurt, but I could be wrong about that.  My lump was not palpable, it was found on a routine mammogram, so I have no direct experience. I can relate to terrified.  My only advice is to keep busy, try not to worry too much (right!), keep (or start) exercising, and have a positive attitude.  Jeez, everything I write seems so stupid and trite.  There is nothing I can say to lessen your apprehension, except to point out that breast cancer is treatable and there are many people on this site who can attest to that.
Posts.Title: Waiting for tests...help! pjr newgirl77
